attachments.title: Reports: “iWatch” aims for October launch, has 2.5” curved touchscreen
attachments.text: Device said to include multiple fitness sensors, could come in several sizes.
attachments.fallback: Ars Technica: Reports: “iWatch” aims for October launch, has 2.5” curved touchscreen

text: I still have a hard time envisioning how this works for Apple. I don't see the need for a smart watch, and I while I think health/wellness tracking is terrific, it doesn't seem like a big enough market for Apple to make such an investment.
as I've said though, I would love to be wrong about this. Mostly because it would mean Apple has considered this is a way I haven't
